name: snooze
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to sleep lightly for a short time, especially somewhere other than in your bed: The dog's snoozing in front of the fire. I snoozed through the whole film.
More examplesFewer examplesDad likes to snooze in front of the TV.The old man was snoozing in the shade.People like to spend the afternoon hours snoozing.

snooze noun
(SLEEP)
[ C ] informal a short, light sleep, especially when you are not in your bed: I had a nice little snooze in the back of the car. I just need a 10-minute snooze and I'll be fine.
More examplesFewer examplesNow seems like a good time for a snooze on the couch.How about a little snooze in front of the TV?Dad's in there having a snooze.The children need an afternoon snooze.

snooze noun
(ON ALARM)
[ U ] a button on an alarm clock (= a clock for waking you up) that makes the sound stop so that you can sleep for a few minutes more, before waking you up again: I start my day by hitting snooze on the alarm clock.
More examplesFewer examplesThe alarm clock keeps ringing, they keep hitting snooze.You roll over to press snooze.Get up as soon as the alarm rings - no using snooze ten times in a row.
